channel.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
channel.description:
Anyone who has a ps3, download the newest trailier is fucking amazing. It also gives away a bit of the "Sad" storyline where we see the end of 'solid snake', its weird in a way, after playing every single metal gear solid since first one, in which is considered by many the best/most important game of all time seeing the end of snake is pretty sad, which for me is very weird because i never feel sad/sorry for any characters in films, t.v shows etc when they die and this is a game!
Oh and the graphics in this trailier seem a little off compared to the ones in the game play videos, which is also surprising since its always the traliers that look better than the actual gameplay. So, is anyone who has a ps3 getting this? if you have not thought of it, i do strongly suggest getting it, even if you have not been a fan of the older games, buy it for the experience, buy it for the storyline, buy it because its one of the greatest game sequels ever.
ps; suicide is not a joke..

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Thug-life:

It’ll be sad to see snake go, there is so many sad moments during this game seeing the people, not just snake that you have seen in all the metal gears before this one die.

Raiden had MGS2 Sons of Liberty.

Even though Snake dies, i’m sure they’ll bring out another MGS involving another character, eventually.

I hope the ending will be better than on Sons Of Liberty, which got strange near the end.

Read full topic
item.source: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

One draw back i’ve found although it can be a good thing is that the story and the gameplay sucks you into it, so much that you can play it for hours without noticing so you could end up finishing it very fast.
I’m on the last act now after 13 hours of gameplay (I have gone through it very fast) yet it seems weeks since i started it although it was only yesterday.

One extra thing i love, is that the cut scenes are rendered fully in real time and you can use the small metal gear robot to go around the aeroplane where you get most of your mission briefings, its technically one of the best games ever made. You would be stupid not to get it, unless you are not a fan of that type of game.

I fucking love this game, over the 10 years since the first metal gear solid on playstation you get attached to snake as i’ve never been by anything before.
It’ll be sad to see snake go, there is so many sad moments during this game seeing the people, not just snake that you have seen in all the metal gears before this one die. I’ll be singing this games praises for as long as i live, sounds sad, but you know, i’m a gamefreak and probably always will be.

Read full topic
item.source: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Another reason why i need a PS3.

The MGS series has always one of the games you play on 50+ hours without getting bored, and only just reaching completion. Every MGS i have played, i’ve always got addicted to after the first few hours of play, even the MGS for the PSP.

If i had a PS3, this would be the first thing i bought.

Has this got any online play ?

Read full topic
item.source: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:16, topic:209128”]This game is so good, it is probably the best game i have ever played. I cannot find a single flaw in it yet and i’ve racked up 10 hours gaming time and found nothing to complain about. I can see this going up in the top best ever games along with the first game, its nothing like what games being released now. Kojima has ignored what other games companys have been doing to try and make money and has actually like all the other metal gear solid game as he keeps saying, i focus my games on something i would want to play. Excellent game, however there will be reviews of this game by people who base they’re reviews on they’re opinions, which you don’t do. You base your reviews on the facts, you review the game on what people who like that type of game like, however many major reviewers now don’t do this which is a shame as there is alot of inaccurate game reviews.

I really want this game to do well for its self and for people to give it the respect the series and the game has earned, it would be a shame if its ruined by those rumoured reviewers who get paid to review games in certain ways.[/quote]

Screw off, now I need to go buy it tonight and I need to be studying for exams

Read full topic
item.source: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

This game is so good, it is probably the best game i have ever played. I cannot find a single flaw in it yet and i’ve racked up 10 hours gaming time and found nothing to complain about. I can see this going up in the top best ever games along with the first game, its nothing like what games being released now. Kojima has ignored what other games companys have been doing to try and make money and has actually like all the other metal gear solid game as he keeps saying, i focus my games on something i would want to play. Excellent game, however there will be reviews of this game by people who base they’re reviews on they’re opinions, which you don’t do. You base your reviews on the facts, you review the game on what people who like that type of game like, however many major reviewers now don’t do this which is a shame as there is alot of inaccurate game reviews.

I really want this game to do well for its self and for people to give it the respect the series and the game has earned, it would be a shame if its ruined by those rumoured reviewers who get paid to review games in certain ways.

Read full topic

I’ve got MGS3 for ps2 though, all great games.

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Thug-life:

With the release date getting near, is anyone else actually getting it? Well anyway, one feature been leaked that im happy about is that it supports full true, 1080p output no scaled up shit, and afaik its the first game to do that. Oh and a 4.8gb install, which is pretty decent considering the full game is 50gb and installs are only after every chapter so you won’t be waiting ages for it to install to first play it

By the amount of space it uses it sounds like its going to be a fantastic and long game.

I would definitely be getting it if I owned a PS3, I may buy one very soon with GTA IV.

Read full topic

item.source: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*

item.title: MGS4 *May contain spoilers in later posts*
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Thug-life:

ps; suicide is not a joke…

That better not be a spoiler!

I sort of was sucked into the MGS franchise, when I first got a playstation my uncle bought me it, and it was always one of those games which felt out of my league. Slowly as I grew older I completed it. Then one day while shopping with my mum I saw mgs2 on the shelve for only £10 so I decided to see how it was. After that I bowered mgs3 from one of my friends and spent a whole day playing through the story. I remember how beautiful the ending was and how sad it made me feel.

Tbh Metal Gear Solid is more like an interactive movie than a game.

Read full topic
